title: Binds to all IPs even when IP specified (discovery socket)

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age

body:
I have 10.0.1.4:22000 for my sync protocol address, 10.0.1.4:8080 for my GUI listen address and 10.0.1.152:22026 for my discovery server address. Yet syncthing still binds to the wildcard UDPv6 address. lsof on the syncthing pid shows:

```

syncthing 20620 myuser  cwd     VDIR     237,3481272452       460       3 /home/myuser
syncthing 20620 myuser  rtd     VDIR     253,1967325397        39       3 /
syncthing 20620 myuser  txt     VREG     117,1126432924   9669960  416459 /usr/local/bin/syncthing
syncthing 20620 myuser  txt     VREG     253,1967325397    429056   36961 /libexec/ld-elf.so.1
syncthing 20620 myuser  txt     VREG     253,1967325397    569520   36934 /lib/libthr.so.3
syncthing 20620 myuser  txt     VREG     253,1967325397   6120144   36873 /lib/libc.so.7
syncthing 20620 myuser    0r    VCHR               0,28       0t0      28 /dev/null
syncthing 20620 myuser    1u    PIPE 0xfffff800c4582d00         0         ->0xfffff800c4582ba0
syncthing 20620 myuser    2u    PIPE 0xfffff803b56d8a18         0         ->0xfffff803b56d88b8
syncthing 20620 myuser    3u    VREG     237,3481272452         0 5805482 /home/myuser/.config/syncthing/index/LOCK
syncthing 20620 myuser    4w    VREG     237,3481272452       800 5852109 /home/myuser/.config/syncthing/index/LOG
syncthing 20620 myuser    5w    VREG     237,3481272452    784613 5852111 /home/myuser/.config/syncthing/index/000118.log
syncthing 20620 myuser    6w    VREG     237,3481272452       802 5852112 /home/myuser/.config/syncthing/index/MANIFEST-000119
syncthing 20620 myuser    8r    VREG     237,3481272452      1696 5853118 /home/myuser/.config/syncthing/index/000120.ldb
syncthing 20620 myuser    9u    IPv4 0xfffff805271a7810       0t0     TCP myhostname:8080 (LISTEN)
syncthing 20620 myuser   10u  KQUEUE 0xfffff801bb3d4e00                   count=0, state=0x2
syncthing 20620 myuser   11u    IPv6 0xfffff8007c165318       0t0     UDP *:10755
syncthing 20620 myuser   12u    IPv4 0xfffff800bc682000       0t0     TCP myhostname:52813->10.0.1.8:22000 (ESTABLISHED)

syncthing 20620 myuser   16u    IPv4 0xfffff80555987000       0t0     TCP myhostname:22000->example13055.nat.example.com:63798 (ESTABLISHED)
syncthing 20620 myuser   17u    IPv4 0xfffff80584c4e810       0t0     TCP myhostname:8080->myhostname:23960 (ESTABLISHED)
syncthing 20620 myuser   18u    IPv4 0xfffff8007c694810       0t0     TCP myhostname:8080->myhostname:23973 (ESTABLISHED)

```

See the line there with IPv6 and UDP *:10755. I think it shouldn't be doing that. What is port 10755 used for?
